title: Sami Sauiluma
text:
Sami Sauiluma (born 14 February 1993) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who has played in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>. He primarily plays at and , but can also fill in at and previously played for the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> and <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Bankstown">Bankstown, New South Wales</a>, Sauiluma is of <a href="Samoans">Samoan</a> descent and played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Woden%20Valley%20Rams">Woden Valley Rams</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>.
Sauiluma is a cousin of <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> player <a href="Tim%20Simona">Tim Simona</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
From 2009 to 2011, Sauiluma played for the Canberra Raiders' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team, before moving on to the Raiders' <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> team, <a href="Mount%20Pritchard%20Mounties">Mount Pritchard Mounties</a> in 2012.
2013.
In Round 15 of the <a href="2013%20NRL%20season">2013 NRL season</a>, Sauiluma made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> against the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>. On 19 September, he was named in the <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoan</a> train-on squad for the <a href="2013%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2013 Rugby League World Cup</a>, but didn't make the final cut.
2014.
On 21 September, Sauiluma was named at centre in the 2014 New South Wales Cup Team of the Year. On 25 September, he signed a 1-year contract with the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> starting in 2015.
2015.
In round 9 of the <a href="2015%20NRL%20season">2015 NRL season</a>, Sauiluma made his Cronulla-Sutherland debut against the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a>. On 27 September, he was named at centre in the 2015 New South Wales Cup Team of the Year, for a second year in a row. At the conclusion of the 2015 season, he was released by Cronulla-Sutherland. In November, he joined the <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Titans">Gold Coast Titans</a> to train in the 2016 pre-season and attempt to gain a contract but this proved unsuccessful.
